org.tal.redstonechips.wireless
Class Wireless

java.lang.Object
  org.tal.redstonechips.wireless.Wireless
Direct Known Subclasses:
Receiver, Transmitter
public abstract class Wireless
extends Object

A Wireless device for sending or receiving over a BroadcastChannel.

Author:
Tal Eisenberg

Field Summary
protected  BroadcastChannel channel
          BroadcastChannel used by this Wireless object.
protected  int channelLength
          The Wireless channel length in bits.
protected  int startBit
          The 1st channel bit this Wireless will send or receive on.

getStartBit

public int getStartBit()
Returns:
The 1st channel bit this Wireless will send or receive on.

setStartBit

public void setStartBit(int startBit)
Sets the Wireless object 1st channel bit.

Parameters:
startBit -

setChannelLength

public void setChannelLength(int length)
Sets the Wireless channel length in bits. This is the maximum number of bits the Wireless will use and doesn't necessarily needs to be the same as the BroadcastChannel length.

Parameters:
length -

getChannelLength

public int getChannelLength()
Returns:
The Wireless channel length.

getCircuit

public Circuit getCircuit()
Returns:
The circuit that uses this Wireless object.

init

public void init(org.bukkit.command.CommandSender sender,
                 String channelString,
                 int channelLength,
                 Circuit c)
          throws IllegalArgumentException
Parses the channel string and registers the class as a wireless device.

Parameters:
sender - The chip creator.
channelString - The channel and optionally the starting bit to communicate on. Format: channel-name[:start-bit]
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - when channelString is invalid or the creator doesn't have channel permissions.

shutdown

public void shutdown()
Deregisters and shuts down the Wireless.
